panels.description: The number of active workers in Kafka Mirror Maker cluster.
panels.title: Total workers

panels.description: The total number of connectors.
panels.title: Total connectors

panels.description: The total number of connector tasks.
panels.title: Total tasks

panels.description: The total number of running connector tasks.
panels.title: Running tasks

panels.description: The total number of failed connector tasks.
panels.title: Failed tasks

panels.description: The total number of paused connector tasks.
panels.title: Paused tasks

panels.description: The total number of unassigned connector tasks.
panels.title: Unassigned tasks

panels.description: The total number of destroyed connector tasks.
panels.title: Destroyed tasks

panels.description: The current status of connectors and their tasks.
panels.title: Connector and task status

panels.description: The status of connectors over time.
panels.title: Connector status over time

panels.description: The status of connector tasks over time.
panels.title: Connector task status over time

panels.description: The time since last rebalance of Kafka Mirror Maker worker.
panels.title: Time since last rebalance [$worker]

panels.description: The per-second number of source records produced/polled (before transformation) by connector task.
panels.title: Source records polled per second (before transformation)

panels.description: The per-second number of source records output from the transformations and written to Kafka for connector task. This is after transformations are applied and excludes any records filtered out by the transformations.
panels.title: Source records written per second (after transformation)

panels.description: The average time in milliseconds taken by connector task to poll for a batch of source records.
panels.title: Source record poll time

panels.description: The average size of the batches processed by the connector task.
panels.title: Task batch size

panels.description: Statistics of connector producers for topics.
panels.title: Producers

panels.description: The number of records sent per second.
panels.title: Records sent per second

panels.description: The number of records in bytes sent per second.
panels.title: Records in bytes sent per second

panels.description: The average time in milliseconds record batches spent in the send buffer.
panels.title: Producer record queue time

panels.description: Statistics of connector consumers for topics.

targets.expr: min(label_join(kafka_consumer_fetch_manager_records_consumed_total{job="$job", instance=~".*$worker.*", clientId=~".*replication-consumer.*", topic=~".+"}, "clientIdAndTopic", "-", "clientId", "topic")) by (clientIdAndTopic, clientId, topic)

min(label_join(kafka_consumer_fetch_manager_bytes_consumed_total{job="$job", instance=~".*$worker.*", clientId=~".*replication-consumer.*", topic=~".+"}, "clientIdAndTopic", "-", "clientId", "topic")) by (clientIdAndTopic, clientId, topic)

panels.title: Consumers

panels.description: The number of records consumed per second.
panels.title: Records consumed per second

panels.description: The number of records in bytes consumed per second.
panels.title: Records in bytes consumed per second

panels.description: The lag in terms of number of records by clients. An increasing value over time is your best indication that the consumer group is not keeping up with the producers.
panels.title: Consumer lag

panels.description: The information about CPU usage.
panels.title: CPU usage [$worker]

panels.description: The information about JVM threads.
panels.title: Threads [$worker]

panels.description: The information about JVM heap memory usage.
panels.title: Heap memory usage [$worker]

panels.description: The number of garbage collections triggered per second.
panels.title: Garbage collections triggered per second [$worker]

panels.description: The information about JVM heap memory usage in percent (%).

targets.expr: 100 * jvm_memory_bytes_used{area="heap", job="$job", instance=~".*$worker.*"} / jvm_memory_bytes_max{area="heap", job="$job", instance=~".*$worker.*"}

panels.title: Heap memory usage in percent [$worker]

panels.description: The time in seconds spent in garbage collection.
panels.title: Time spent in garbage collection [$worker]
